name: Pebbles Pillow Cover 18 x 18 Black
description:
This is an 18" x 18" throw pillow cover with Leah's "pebbles" pattern in a limited edition black colorway. It is hand screen-printed with water-based yellow, peach, and white ink on soft 100% natural black linen. It is removable with a hidden zip closure at the bottom.

- Hand Wash, Dry Clean, or Spot Clean only (these are individually hand printed and machine washing may sacrifice the integrity of the ink)
- Hang dry
- Iron inside out as needed

These pillows are hand printed therefor small blemishes and variations in density within the ink may occur. This makes each pillow a unique, individual work of art to add to your home.

Insert not included. These fit a 20" x 20" pillow insert.

Made in Brooklyn, NY.

Â© leah duncan

name: 2014 12-Month Calendar
description:
This is Leah's 2014 12-Month Desert Shapes Calendar. Inspired by her trips to Marfa, Texas while living in Austin each month reflects the colors and shapes of the west Texas landscape. 

- Crane Lettra 100% cotton paper
- 4.25" x 11"
- hole punched
- tied with twine
- limited edition of 325

This calendar looks great when hung in a grouping or singly on a pin. Trim off the calendar portion when the month is over and frame it as artwork!

Your calendar will be shipped with cardboard backing in a cellophane sleeve to ensure it arrives safely.

name: Succulent Poster 17 x 22
description:
This poster is a part of Leah's collaboration with Jeanee Ledoux of Finely Crafted. Each poster features 17 of Leah's succulent drawings. Inspired by scientific botanical illustrations this striking poster is a fun and modern spin on the subject with each latin plant name listed.

- 17" x 22"
- matte, cotton, archival paper
- limited edition of 200
- signed and numbered on the backside

Your poster will be packaged in a plastic sleeve and cardboard mailing tube. These posters easily pick up finger prints so we recommend clean hands when you hang or frame your print.

We're sorry, but this poster cannot be combined to ship with other items as it is large and has to be shipped in a mailing tube to avoid damage.

name: Tumbleweed Wall Calendar
description:
This is Leah's 2014 wall calendar featuring her "tumbleweed" pattern. Inspired by the desert and Leah's trips to Marfa, Texas.

- 11" x 17"
- Crane Lettra 110lb 100% cotton paper
- limited edition of 100
- hand-numbered at bottom

Cut off the calendar portion at the end of the year and frame the artwork!

Your calendar will be shipped in a cellophane sleeve and wedged between cardboard in a flat mailer to ensure it arrives safely.

name: Little Mountains Brass Cuff
description:
This is a piece created in collaboration with Ash Hilton Jewellery. Each piece has been designed by Leah and hand carved by Ash in his workshop in New Zealand using ethically-sourced materials. Each cuff is one size fits all and can be bent to fit most wrists.

- Ethically-sourced brass
- 1" wide
- Matte finish
- Maker's mark etched on underside

When worn, all jewelry will find it's own finish as it is constantly "polished" by rubbing against your clothes. Brass is an ever-changing metal that develops a patina quickly if it gets wet or is left unworn. To maintain it's golden hue, you can polish it with a jewelry polishing cloth, with 600 grit sandpaper or a green Scotch pad. Please mind the etchings so as not to take the color out. 

Your cuff will be shipped via USPS Priority Mail with tracking. International orders will be shipped via registered mail and may require a signature on delivery.

name: Angles Furoshiki
description:
We're thrilled to share Leah's collaboration with The Link Collective! This is a pre-order and will begin shipping at the end of April. We have 10 available in Leah's shop and the rest will be sold through The Link Collective. Carry straps can be ordered directly from the link collective: https://www.etsy.com/shop/thelinkcollective.

Size: 900 x 900 mm (35.4 x 35.4")
Material : 100% cotton shantung (heavier weight Japanese crepe cloth)
Handmade in Japan, using Japanese traditional printing techniques. 

-About Furoshiki-
Furoshiki (é¢¨åæ·, fu-rosh-ki) is a type of traditional Japanese wrapping cloth. It can be used in multiple ways, for bundling or gift-wrapping all sorts of things â from lunch boxes or books, to watermelons and bottles of wine. You could even tie it into a handbag or use it as a scarf, a baby blanket or even a wall hanging. One simple and beautiful piece of cloth and the list is endless. Tie it and see!

-Designers words-
Inspired by the angles and shapes of Japanese origami techniques, the elements of this design weave around the fabric to create a bold geometric pattern that reflects my roots, mimicking elements of the traditional tapestry designs found in the southwestern United States.

2 colour printing. 

-Printing process-
Each of our products has been hand printed in Japan, using traditional printing techniques. We are working with a great printing company called Chiffonez in Tokyo, who specialize in the printing of furoshiki. To make sure we get the best results possible, we keep a close dialogue with the printers, retaining a good balance between our ideas and their invaluable knowledge.

Factory Interview here: 
http://www.spoon-tamago.com/2012/07/02/link-furoshiki-interview-factory-shoot/?shareadraft=baba15741_4ff06032a600b

-About LINK-
LINK is a unique and challenging project conducted long-distance, entirely via the internet, by busy women with a world-wide vision. Collaborating with a select global network of artists and designers, it aims to cross cultures and generations by creating beautiful and functional products, from Japan to the world and from the world to Japan.

Photo : Â©Martin Holtkamp http://ma-ho.com/
Model : Chiro Watai
Design : Leah Duncan http://www.leahduncan.com

For more information visit us at : http://thelinkcollective.com
How to use video : http://www.youtube.com/user/LinkCollective/videos

name: Mountain Blossom Furoshiki
description:
We're thrilled to share Leah's collaboration with The Link Collective! This is a pre-order and will begin shipping at the end of April. We have 10 available in Leah's shop and the rest will be sold through The Link Collective. Carry straps can be ordered directly from the link collective: https://www.etsy.com/shop/thelinkcollective.

Size: 900 x 900 mm (35.4 x 35.4")
Material : 100% cotton satin (lighter weight, smooth cotton)
Handmade in Japan, using Japanese traditional printing techniques. 

-About Furoshiki-
Furoshiki (é¢¨åæ·, fu-rosh-ki) is a type of traditional Japanese wrapping cloth. It can be used in multiple ways, for bundling or gift-wrapping all sorts of things. We think this particular lighter-weight furoshiki works well for more delicate wrapping and perfectly as a scarf, and it softens up the more you wear and wash it. One simple and beautiful piece of cloth and the list is endless. Tie it and see!


-Designers words-
This design was inspired by the famous cherry blossom mountain view in Japan at sunrise. The elements are subtle, which creates a delicate and abstract pattern when the furoshiki is wrapped, folded, and worn.

3 colour printing. 

-Printing process-
Each of our products has been hand printed in Japan, using traditional printing techniques. We are working with a great printing company called Chiffonez in Tokyo, who specialize in the printing of furoshiki. To make sure we get the best results possible, we keep a close dialogue with the printers, retaining a good balance between our ideas and their invaluable knowledge.

Factory Interview here: 
http://www.spoon-tamago.com/2012/07/02/link-furoshiki-interview-factory-shoot/?shareadraft=baba15741_4ff06032a600b

-About LINK-
LINK is a unique and challenging project conducted long-distance, entirely via the internet, by busy women with a world-wide vision. Collaborating with a select global network of artists and designers, it aims to cross cultures and generations by creating beautiful and functional products, from Japan to the world and from the world to Japan.

Photo : Â©Martin Holtkamp http://ma-ho.com/
Model : Chihiro Watai
Design : Leah Duncan http://www.leahduncan.com

For more information visit us at: http://thelinkcollective.com

name: SALE Studio SloMo & Leah Duncan Recipe Cards /  Tea Towel Set
description:
On sale - 40% off!

This is a listing for Leah's collaboration with Sarah at Studio SloMo! The set includes one cotton/linen blend tea towel and six letterpress recipe cards. The towel is stitched on four sides with a loop for hanging and measures 19" x 31". It is 52% linen and 48% cotton. The recipe cards are 4" x 6" and include a spot to write out your ingredients and directions. Ink colors include pink, golden yellow, warm gray, and indigo.

Machine wash cool. Tumble dry low. Iron as needed. Recipe cards will be shipped in a cello sleeve and bundled with the towel and tag as shown.

All orders are shipped via USPS first class. Delivery confirmation and tracking are extra. If you would like either or faster shipping, please contact me prior to placing your order so that we can calculate shipping costs.
